Only those who indulge in immoral acts should be afraid."{{cite news |url=http://www.timesonline.co.uk/tol/news/world/asia/article4678530.ece |title=Three teenagers buried alive in 'honour killings' |accessdate=31 March 2011 |work=Times Online |location=London |first=Zahid |last=Hussain |date=5 September 2008}}{{cite news | url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/worldnews/asia/pakistan/2660881/Pakistani-women-buried-alive-for-choosing-husbands.html |title=Pakistani women buried alive 'for choosing husbands'|accessdate=31 March 2011 |work=Telegraph |location=London |date=1 September 2008 |first=Our |last=Foreign}} Nilofar Bakhtiar, Minister for Tourism and Advisor to Pakistan Prime Minister on Women's Affairs, who had struggled against the honor killing in Pakistan, resigned in April 2007 after the clerics accused her of bringing shame to Pakistan by para-jumping with a male and hugging him after landing.{{cite news |url=https://www.forbes.com/facesinthenews/2007/04/10/bakhtiar-pakistan-fatwa-face-cx_rd_0410autofacescan01.html |date=10 April 2007 |work=Forbes |title=Hug Sparks Fatwa Against Pakistani Minister |accessdate=6 July 2011 |first=Ruth |last=David}}{{cite web |url=http://divaneemagazine.wordpress.com/2007/05/29/nilofer-bakhtiar-pakistan-tourism-minister-resigns-for-obscenity |title=Nilofer Bakhtiar – Pakistan tourism minister resigns for obscenity |date=29 May 2007 |accessdate=6 July 2011 |work=DivaneeMagazine.wordpress.com}} ===Victims=== ''This is an incomplete list of notable victims of Honor killing''. ''See also [[:Category:Honor killing victims|Category:Victims of honor killing]]'' {{Div col|colwidth=22em}} * [[Noor Faleh Almaleki]] * [[Shafilea Ahmed]] – Murdered by family for rejecting a marriage partner. * [[Du’a Khalil Aswad]] – [[Yazidi]] girl who was killed for supposedly converting to Islam to date a Muslim boy in Iraq * [[Qandeel Baloch]]{{cite web|title=Pakistani social media star Qandeel Baloch was allegedly murdered by her older brother in response to "the kind of pictures she had been posting online."|url=https://www.facebook.com/UsWeekly/posts/10153912141035805}} * [[Anooshe Sediq Ghulam]] * [[Tulay Goren]] (UK) * [[Leila Hussein]] and her daughter Rand Abdel-Qader * [[Palestina Isa]] * [[Kaithal honour killing case|Manoj and Babli]] * [[Sandeela Kanwal]] * [[Nitish Katara]] * [[Honour killing of Ghazala Khan|Ghazala Khan]] – Murdered by brother for marrying against the will of the family. * [[Katya Koren]] (Ukraine) * [[Banaz Mahmod]]. Her story was chronicled in the 2012 documentary film "[[Banaz a Love Story]]". * [[Samaira Nazir]] * [[Aqsa Parvez]] * [[Uzma Rahan]] and sons, Adam and Abbas, and daughter, Henna (UK) * [[Caneze Riaz]] and her four daughters, Sayrah, Sophia, Alicia and Hannah (UK) * [[Fadime Sahindal]] * [[Tursunoy Saidazimova]] * [[Amina and Sarah Said]] * [[Hina Salem]] (Italy) * [[Samia Sarwar]] * [[Shafia family murders|Zainab, Sahar, and Geeti Shafia, and Rona Amir Mohammad]] * [[Sadia Sheikh]] * [[Jaswinder Kaur Sidhu]]{{cite web|title=Justice For Jassi|url=http://www.justiceforjassi.com|publisher=''justiceforjassi.com''|accessdate=27 September 2008|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20080810120418/http://www.justiceforjassi.com/|archivedate=10 August 2008|df=dmy-all}} * [[Hatun Sürücü]][http://www.hinduonnet.com/fline/fl2414/stories/20070727003103500.htm Welcome to Frontline : Vol. 28 :: No. 20] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20100412144515/http://www.hinduonnet.com/fline/fl2414/stories/20070727003103500.htm |date=12 April 2010 }}. Hinduonnet.com. Retrieved 1 October 2011. * [[Swera]] (Switzerland) * [[Heshu Yones]] (UK) * [[Nurkhon Yuldasheva]] * [[Aasiya Zubair]] {{div col end}} ==Comparison to other forms of killing== {{Main|Femicide}} Honor killings are, along with [[dowry killing]]s (mostly in [[South Asia]]), gang-related killings of women as revenge (killings of female members of rival gang members' families – primarily, but not only, in [[Latin America]]) and [[witchcraft]] accusation killings ([[Africa]], [[Oceania]]) some of the most recognized forms of [[femicide|gender based killings]]. [[Human rights]] advocates have compared "honor killings" to "[[crimes of passion]]" [[#Latin America|in Latin America]] (which are sometimes treated extremely leniently) and also to the killing of women for [[dowry system in India|lack of dowry in India]]. Some commentators have stressed that the focus on honor killings should not lead to ignoring other forms of gender-based killings of women, in particular those from Latin America ('crimes of passion' and gang related killings); the murder rate of women in this region being extremely high, with [[El Salvador]] being reported as the country with the highest murder rate of women in the world.{{cite web|url=http://www.unwomen.org/en/news/stories/2013/4/femicide-in-latin-america|title=Femicide in Latin America|work=headQuarters|accessdate=20 April 2015}} In 2002, Widney Brown, advocacy director for [[Human Rights Watch]], stated that "crimes of passion have a similar dynamic in that the women are killed by male family members and the crimes are perceived as excusable or understandable". ==See also== * [[Blood atonement]], a controversial concept in [[Mormonism]] that is similar to the practice of honor killing * ''[[Chronicle of a Death Foretold]]'' * [[Corrective rape]] * [[Crime of passion]] * [[Crimes against humanity]] * [[Extramarital sex]] * [[Face (sociological concept)]], a classification of honor * [[Gender apartheid]] * [[Hate crime]] * [[Honor suicide]] * [[Izzat (honour)]] * [[Ka-Mer]] * [[Memini]] * [[Namus]] * [[Shame society]] * [[Slut-shaming]] * [[Universal Declaration of Human Rights]] * [[Violence against LGBT people]] ==References== {{Reflist}} ==Further reading== *''[[NDTV]]''. [http://www.ndtv.com/article/cities/paras-bhasin-case-wife-tells-police-he-attempted-suicide-twice-before-263134 Honour killing in Delhi 4 Sep 2012.] *Burke, Jason. ''[[The Guardian]]''. [https://www.theguardian.com/world/2010/jun/25/triple-murder-india-honour-killings Triple murder in India highlights increase in 'honour killings']. 25 June 2010. *Emery, James. [http://www.worldandi.com/newhome/public/2003/may/clpub.asp Reputation is Everything: Honor Killing among the Palestinians]. 2003. * "Jordan Parliament Supports Impunity for Honor Killing", [[Washington, D.C.]]: [[Human Rights Watch]] news release, January 2000. *''Burned Alive: A Victim of the Law of Men''. ({{ISBN|0-446-53346-7}}) Alleged first-person account of [[Burned Alive|Souad]], a victim of an attempted honor killing. The authenticity of this work has been questioned, as it is based on a [[repressed memory]] report. **{{cite news|last=Knox|first=Malcolm|title=Historian challenges Palestinian bestseller|url=http://www.smh.com.au/news/Books/Historian-challenges-Palestinian-bestseller/2005/04/12/1113251628102.html|publisher=''[[Sydney Morning Herald]]''|accessdate=13 April 2005 | date=13 April 2005}} * Schulze, Kirsten, Martin Stokes and Colm Campbell (1996) (eds.), ''Nationalism, Minorities and Diasporas: Identities and Rights in the Middle East'' (London: I.B. Tauris) *Tintori, Karen, 2007. ''Unto the Daughters: The Legacy of an Honor Killing in a Sicilian-American Family''. St. Martin's Press. *Wikan, Unni, 2002. ''Generous Betrayal: Politics of Culture in the New Europe''. University of Chicago Press. *Yavuz, Ercan. ''Today's Zaman''. 1 August 2010. *Sanghera, Jasvinder, 2009. "Daughters of shame" * Ercan, Selen A., 2014. Theory, Policy and Practice, London: Palgrave Macmillan, pp. 199–218. *[https://www.opendemocracy.net/selen-ercan/dangerous-silence-debating-honour-killings Ercan, Selen A., 2014. Dangerous silence: Debating 'honour killings'. Open Democracy, 1 July 2014] ==External links== *[http://english.aljazeera.net/news/europe/2008/10/2008102292619942890.html UK police start 'honour' crime plan] (Al Jazeera News) *[https://www.pbs.org/wnet/wideangle/uncategorized/murder-in-the-name-of-honor-documents/5302/ One Woman's Brave Struggle to Expose "Honor Killings"] (PBS WIDE ANGLE) * [https://web.archive.org/web/20110416222038/http://english.samaylive.com/nation/676466616.html Bill in Parliament to curb honour killing: Moily] * [https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-england-18161066 Shafilea Ahmed victim of honor killing]; BBC News: 21 May 2012 at 19:44 * [http://www.newageislam.com/islam,-women-and-feminism/honour-killing--religious-connections/d/8511 Honour Killing: Religious Connections (NewAgeIslam)] *{{cite web |url=http://www.unfpa.org/publications/detail.cfm?ID=320&filterListType= |title=The Dynamics of Honour Killings in Turkey: Prospects for Action |publisher=[[United Nations Development Programme]] summarizes and evaluates qualitative research about honour killings |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://archive.is/20070213201233/http://www.unfpa.org/publications/detail.cfm?ID=320&filterListType= |archivedate=13 February 2007 |accessdate=11 April 2017}} *[https://www.rollingstone.com/culture/news/pakistans-kim-kardashian-murdered-in-honor-killing-w429516 'Pakistan's Kim Kardashian' Murdered by Brother in 'Honor Killing'] {{Domestic violence}} {{Violence against women/end}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Honor Killing}} [[Category:Honor killing| ]] [[Category:Honor]] [[Category:Homicide]] [[Category:Domestic violence]] [[Category:Gender-related violence]] [[Category:Violence against women]] [[Category:Misogyny]] [[Category:Violence against LGBT people]] [[Category:Crimes against women]] [[Category:Killings by type]]

'''Kazuo Uzuki''' is the subject of a [[baseball card]] issued by [[Topps]] as an [[April Fools' Day]] [[hoax]]. The card was released on February 6, 2008 of a supposed [[high school]] superstar named Kazuo "The Uzi" Uzuki. In [[Japanese language|Japanese]], Kazuo Uzuki means "the first son of April." The person actually depicted on the card was a [[New York University]] law student named Sensen Lin.
He is listed as 5'11" and 165 lbs and could supposedly throw a 104 mph pitch. According to the card, Uzuki would be the first Japanese player to go straight from high school in [[Japan]] into [[MLB|professional baseball]] in the [[United States]].
The Uzuki rookie card was found in one out of every 72 packs of cards.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://sportsillustrated.cnn.com/2008/baseball/mlb/04/01/topps.fools.ap/index.html?eref=mostpop |title=Topps prints card of fake star - Tuesday April 1, 2008 5:53PM |publisher=Sportsillustrated.cnn.com |date=2008-04-01|accessdate=2010-09-01|location=New York|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20080402095411/http://sportsillustrated.cnn.com/2008/baseball/mlb/04/01/topps.fools.ap/index.html?eref=mostpop|archivedate=Apr 2, 2008}}</ref> When the card was released, people did not know that it was a joke and the card was trading for around $10–$15 on [[eBay]]. It was even the "card of the day" when it was released.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://cardboardmania.blogspot.com/2008/02/card-of-day-2008-topps-kazuo-uzuki-rc.html |title=Cardboard Mania: Card of the Day: 2008 Topps Kazuo Uzuki RC |publisher=Cardboardmania.blogspot.com |date=2008-02-09 |accessdate=2010-09-01}}</ref>
Also, the card said that an [[MLB]] scout called him the best pitching prospect in 30 years and he is getting a astronomical deal. Also, the card says he threw 17 strikeouts in 7 innings at a [[World Baseball Classic|WBC]] squad trial.
==See also== {{Portal|Baseball|2000s}} *[[Sidd Finch]]

[[File:Lincoln inaugural bible.jpg|thumb|200px|Lincoln Bible]] The '''Lincoln Bible''' is the [[Bible]] owned by [[President of the United States|President]] [[Abraham Lincoln]], and was later used by [[Barack Obama]] at his inaugurations in [[First inauguration of Barack Obama|2009]] and [[Second inauguration of Barack Obama|2013]], as well as the [[inauguration of Donald Trump]] in 2017. The Lincoln family donated the Bible to the [[Library of Congress]], which includes it in their collection.
==Overview== The Bible is an [[Oxford University Press]] edition of the [[King James Version|King James Bible]]. Published in 1853, it has 1280 pages, and measures approximately {{convert|6|in}} long by {{convert|4|in}} wide, and {{convert|1.75|in}} thick,<ref name="ET">{{cite web |url=http://economictimes.indiatimes.com/ET_Cetera/Obama_first_Prez_to_use_Lincolns_Bible/articleshow/4008813.cms |title=Obama first president to use Lincoln's Bible |publisher=The Economic Times |date=January 20, 2009}}</ref><ref name="LoC"/> and is bound in [[burgundy red]] [[velvet]] with [[Gilding|gilt]] edges.<ref name="LoC">{{cite web |url=https://www.loc.gov/today/pr/2008/08-236.html |title=President-Elect Obama To Take Oath of Office on Lincoln-Inaugural Bible from Library of Congress |publisher=[[Library of Congress]] |date=December 23, 2008}}</ref><ref name="MSNBC"/> The back [[Book design#Front cover, spine, and back cover of the dust-jacket|flyleaf]] of the Bible bears the seal of the Supreme Court of the United States along with a record of the 1861 inauguration.<ref name=usnews/> The Bible is not a rare edition, and a similar Bible lacking the Lincoln Bible's historical significance would be valued at approximately $30 or $40.<ref name=usnews/>
==History== [[file:Donald Trump swearing in ceremony.jpg|right|thumb|255px|[[Donald Trump]] using the Lincoln Bible (being held by wife [[Melania Trump]], with his personal bible on top of it) to take oath of office at his inauguration.]] [[Abraham Lincoln]] reached [[Washington, D.C.]] for [[First inauguration of Abraham Lincoln|his inauguration]] in 1861. His belongings, including his Bible, had yet to arrive. William Thomas Carroll, the clerk of the [[Supreme Court of the United States|U.S. Supreme Court]], fetched a Bible that he kept for official use. This became the Lincoln Bible.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.cbsnews.com/2100-18563_162-4736457.html |title=The Real Story Of The Lincoln Bible |publisher=CBS News |date= |accessdate=2012-08-13}}</ref> Although the Bible remained with Carroll for a time, the Lincolns acquired it at an unknown time. The Bible later remained with the Lincoln family up until 1928, at which point [[Mary Eunice Harlan]], the widow of [[Robert Todd Lincoln]], donated it to the [[Library of Congress]].<ref name=usnews>{{cite web|url=https://www.usnews.com/news/blogs/god-and-country/2008/12/23/the-story-behind-the-lincoln-bible-at-obamas-inauguration |title=The Story Behind the Lincoln Bible at Obama's Inauguration - God & Country |publisher=usnews.com |date=2008-12-23 |accessdate=2012-08-13}}</ref> When the Bible was donated, it contained markers at the 31st chapter of the [[Book of Deuteronomy]] and the fourth chapter of the [[Book of Hosea]].<ref>{{cite news |url=https://news.google.com/newspapers?id=1XVFAAAAIBAJ&sjid=obwMAAAAIBAJ&pg=958,4959444&dq=lincoln-bible&hl=en |title=Lincoln's Bible Pages Marked: Was it Chance That Left Two Ribbon Markers At Passages? Verses Seen as Appropriate: Bring to Mind Dark Days That Lincoln Passed Through After Taking Office |agency=[[Associated Press]] |newspaper=The Telegraph-Herald |page=12 |date=December 2, 1928 |deadurl=no |accessdate=2013-08-09}}</ref> [[Barack Obama]] chose this Bible for his inaugurations in [[First inauguration of Barack Obama|2009]]<ref name="MSNBC">{{cite news |url=http://www.msnbc.msn.com/id/28366102/ |date=December 23, 2008 |title=Obama chooses Lincoln's Bible for inauguration |deadurl=no |accessdate=2013-08-09}}</ref> and [[Second inauguration of Barack Obama|2013]].<ref>{{cite web|last=Ori |first=Ryan |url=http://www.pjstar.com/news/x127109197/Lincoln-Bible-heightens-symbolism |title=Lincoln Bible heightens symbolism - Peoria, IL |publisher=pjstar.com |date= |accessdate=2012-08-13}}</ref> The Bible was on display at the [[Library of Congress]] until 2009 in a celebration of the bicentennial of Lincoln's birth.<ref name="LoC"/> The Bible was used to swear in [[Carla Hayden]] as the 14th [[Librarian of Congress]] on September 14, 2016.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://blogs.loc.gov/loc/2016/09/welcome-carla-hayden/#comment-1586765|title=Welcome Carla Hayden|last=|first=|date=September 15, 2016|website=loc.gov|publisher=Library of Congress|access-date=}}</ref> [[Donald Trump]] was sworn in on this Bible and his childhood Bible at [[Inauguration of Donald Trump|his inauguration]] on January 20, 2017.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/news/morning-mix/wp/2017/01/18/the-symbolism-of-trumps-two-inaugural-bible-choices-from-lincoln-to-his-mother/ |title=The symbolism of Trump’s two inaugural Bible choices, from Lincoln to his mother |newspaper=[[The Washington Post]] |first=Katie |last=Mettler |date=January 18, 2017 |access-date=January 21, 2017}}</ref>
==See also== * [[United States presidential inauguration#List of inaugural ceremonies and other oath takings|United States presidential inauguration]] * [[George Washington Inaugural Bible]] * [[Religious views of Abraham Lincoln]]

The word "Lucy" is written in a large, bold red font at the top right corner, while the words "First to the Trojans" and "SWRI{{dot}}NASA{{dot}}LM" are written in a smaller white font across the bottom edges of the diamond-shaped crest. | insignia_caption = Official insignia for the ''Lucy'' mission

'''''Lucy''''' is a planned [[NASA]] [[space probe]] that will tour five [[Jupiter trojan]]s, [[asteroid]]s which share Jupiter's [[orbit]] around the [[Sun]], orbiting either ahead of or behind the planet. All will be fly-by missions.<ref name="NYT-20170106">{{cite news |url=https://www.nytimes.com/2017/01/06/science/nasa-psyche-asteroid.html |title=A Metal Ball the Size of Massachusetts That NASA Wants to Explore |work=[[The New York Times]] |last=Chang |first=Kenneth |date=6 January 2017 |accessdate=7 January 2017}}</ref>
On 4 January 2017, ''Lucy'' was chosen, along with the [[Psyche (spacecraft)|''Psyche'' mission]], as NASA's [[Discovery Program]] missions 13 and 14 respectively.<ref name="NYT-20170106" /><ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.nasa.gov/press-release/nasa-selects-two-missions-to-explore-the-early-solar-system |title=NASA Selects Two Missions to Explore the Early Solar System |first=Karen |last=Northon |publisher=NASA |date=4 January 2017}}</ref>
The mission is named after the [[Lucy (Australopithecus)|'Lucy' hominin skeleton]], because the study of Trojans could reveal the "fossils of planet formation": materials that clumped together in the early history of the [[Solar System]] to form planets and other bodies.<ref name="Nature2015">{{cite news |url=http://www.nature.com/news/five-solar-system-sights-nasa-should-visit-1.17119 |title=Five Solar System sights NASA should visit |work=[[Nature News]] |last=Witze |first=Alexandra |date=16 March 2015 |accessdate=2 October 2015}}</ref> The Australopithecus itself was named for a [[Beatles]] song, "[[Lucy in the Sky with Diamonds]]".<ref name=Dinkinesh>{{cite book |title=Lucy's Legacy: The Quest for Human Origins |publisher=[[Crown Publishing Group]] |date=2010 |last1=Johanson |first1=Donald C. |last2=Wong |first2=Kate |pages=8–9 |isbn=978-0-307-39640-2}}</ref>
==Overview== [[File:InnerSolarSystem-en.png|thumb|left|upright=0.9|The [[Jupiter trojan]] asteroids are shown in green]]
''Lucy'' is planned to launch in 2021 and will arrive at the {{L4}} Trojan cloud (a group of asteroids that orbits about 60° ahead of Jupiter) in 2027, where it will fly by four Trojans, [[3548 Eurybates]], [[15094 Polymele]], [[11351 Leucus]], and [[21900 Orus]].<ref name="NYT-20170106" /> After these flybys, ''Lucy'' will return to the vicinity of the Earth whereupon it will receive a [[gravity assist]] to take it to the {{L5}} Trojan cloud (which trails about 60° behind Jupiter), where it will visit the [[Binary asteroid|binary]] Trojan [[617 Patroclus]] with its [[minor-planet moon|satellite]] Menoetius. ''Lucy'' will also fly by the inner main-belt asteroid [[52246 Donaldjohanson]], which was named for the discoverer of the Lucy hominin fossil.<ref name="round 1">{{cite news |url=http://www.planetary.org/blogs/casey-dreier/2015/09301336-discovery-downselect.html |title=NASA announces five Discovery proposals selected for further study |work=[[The Planetary Society]] |last=Dreier |first=Casey |last2=Lakdawalla |first2=Emily |date=30 September 2015 |accessdate=1 October 2015}}</ref>
Three instruments comprise the payload: a high-resolution visible imager, an optical and near-infrared imaging spectrometer and a thermal infrared spectrometer.<ref>{{cite press release |url=http://www.swri.org/press-release/swri-awarded-3-million-nasa-contract-develop-mission-jupiter%E2%80%99s-trojan-asteroids |title=SwRI awarded $3 million NASA contract to develop mission to Jupiter's Trojan asteroids |publisher=Southwest Research Institute |first=Rob |last=Leibold |date=2 October 2015 |accessdate=5 October 2015}}</ref>
[[Harold F. Levison]] of the [[Southwest Research Institute]] in Boulder, Colorado is the Principal Investigator with Catherine Olkin of [[Southwest Research Institute]] as the mission's Deputy Principal Investigator. NASA's [[Goddard Space Flight Center]] will manage the project.
Exploration of Jupiter Trojans was one of the high priority goals outlined in the [[Planetary Science Decadal Survey]].
Jupiter Trojans have been observed by ground-based telescopes and the [[Wide-field Infrared Survey Explorer]] to be "dark with ... surfaces that reflect little sunlight".<ref>{{cite web |url=http://photojournal.jpl.nasa.gov/catalog/PIA16211 |title=Catalog Page for PIA16211 |publisher=}}</ref> Jupiter is {{convert|5.2|AU|e6km+e6mi|abbr=unit}} from the Sun, or about five times the Earth-Sun distance.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.nasa.gov/audience/forstudents/5-8/features/nasa-knows/what-is-jupiter-58.html |title=What Is Jupiter? |first=Jennifer |last=Wall |date=1 June 2015 |publisher=}}</ref> The Jupiter Trojans are at a similar distance but can be somewhat farther or closer to the Sun depending on where they are in their orbits. There may be as many Trojans as there are asteroids in the asteroid belt.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.planetary.org/blogs/casey-dreier/2015/09301336-discovery-downselect.html |title=NASA announces five Discovery proposals selected for further study |publisher=}}</ref> {{clear}}
==Development== {{main|Selection of Discovery Mission 13 and 14}} ''Lucy'' was submitted as part of a call for proposals for the next mission(s) for [[Discovery Program]] that closed in February 2015. Proposals had to be ready to launch by the end of 2021. 28 proposals were received in all.
On 30 September 2015, ''Lucy'' was selected as one of five finalist missions, each of which received 3 million USD to produce more in-depth concept design studies and analyses.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.swri.org/9what/releases/2015/swri-nasa-contract-mission-jupiter-trojan-asteroid.htm#.VhUiX_Bdgnc |title=Southwest Research Institute (SwRI) 2015 News Release - SwRI awarded $3 million NASA contract to develop mission to Jupiter’s Trojan asteroids |publisher=}}</ref><ref name="selection 1st round">{{cite news |last=Brown |first=Dwayne C. |last2=Cantillo |first2=Laurie |url=http://www.nasa.gov/press-release/nasa-selects-investigations-for-future-key-planetary-mission |title=NASA Selects Investigations for Future Key Planetary Mission |work=NASA News |location=Washington, D.C. |date=30 September 2015 |accessdate=1 October 2015}}</ref><ref name="laser2015">{{cite news |last=Clark |first=Stephen |url=http://spaceflightnow.com/2015/02/24/nasa-receives-proposals-for-new-planetary-science-mission/ |title=NASA receives proposals for new planetary science mission |work=Space Flight Now |date=24 February 2014 |accessdate=25 February 2015}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |last=Kane |first=Van |url=http://www.planetary.org/blogs/guest-blogs/van-kane/20141201-selecting-the-next-creative-discovery-mission.html |title=Selecting the Next Creative Idea for Exploring the Solar System |work=[[Planetary Society]] |date=2 December 2014 |accessdate=10 February 2015}}</ref> Its fellow finalists were [[DAVINCI (spacecraft)|''DAVINCI'']], [[Near Earth Object Camera|NEOCam]], [[Psyche (spacecraft)|''Psyche'']] and [[VERITAS (spacecraft)|''VERITAS'']]. On 4 January 2017, two of the five proposals—''Lucy'' and ''Psyche''—were selected for development and launch.
==Science payload== Instrumentation includes:<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.swri.org/9what/releases/2015/swri-nasa-contract-mission-jupiter-trojan-asteroid.htm |title=Southwest Research Institute (SwRI) 2015 News Release - SwRI awarded $3 million NASA contract to develop mission to Jupiter’s Trojan asteroids |publisher=Southwest Research Institute}}</ref> *L'Ralph - panchromatic and color visible imager and infrared spectroscopic mapper. L'Ralph is based on the [[Ralph (New Horizons)|Ralph instrument on New Horizons]] and will be built at Goddard Space Flight Center. *L'LORRI - high-resolution visible imager. L'LORRI is derived from the [[Long Range Reconnaissance Imager|LORRI instrument on New Horizons]] and will be built at the Johns Hopkins University Applied Physics Laboratory. *L'TES - thermal infrared spectrometer. L'TES is similar to OTES on the OSIRIS-REx mission and will be built at Arizona State University. *The radio science investigation will determine the mass of the Trojans by using the spacecraft radio telecommunications hardware to measure Doppler shifts.
== Targets == [[File:Lucy spacecraft trajectory.png|thumb|''Lucy'' will alternately visit Jupiter's [[Greek camp|Greek]] ({{L4|nolink=yes}}) and [[Trojan camp]]s ({{L5|nolink=yes}}) every six years.]]
Targets with their flyby dates include:<ref name="round 1"/><ref name="lucy.ao.resp">{{cite web |url=https://planetary.s3.amazonaws.com/assets/resources/NASA/Lucy_Flyer.pdf |title=Lucy: Surveying the Diversity of Trojan Asteroids, the Fossils of Planet Formation |publisher=Southwest Research Institute |date=2015 |accessdate=11 July 2017}}</ref><ref name="Levison2017">{{cite conference |url=https://www.hou.usra.edu/meetings/lpsc2017/pdf/2025.pdf |title=Lucy: Surveying the Diversity of the Trojan Asteroids, the Fossils of Planet Formation |conference=48th Lunar and Planetary Science Conference. 20–24 March 2017. The Woodlands, Texas. |first1=H. F. |last1=Levison |first2=C. |last2=Olkin |first3=K. S. |last3=Noll |first4=S. |last4=Marchi |id=LPI Contribution No. 1964, id. 2025 |date=March 2017 |bibcode=2017LPI....48.2025L}}</ref> * 20 April 2025: [[52246 Donaldjohanson]], 4 km diameter C-type asteroid in the inner [[Asteroid belt|main belt]], member of ~130 Myr old Erigone family; * 12 August 2027: [[3548 Eurybates]], 64 km diameter C-type [[Jupiter trojan]] in the [[Greek camp]] at {{L4}}, largest member of the only confirmed disruptive collisional family in the Trojans; * 15 September 2027: [[15094 Polymele]], 21 km diameter P-type Trojan at {{L4}}, likely collisional fragment; * 18 April 2028: [[11351 Leucus]], 34 km diameter D-type [[slow rotator (asteroid)|slowly rotating]] Trojan at {{L4}}; * 11 November 2028: [[21900 Orus]], 51 km diameter D-type Trojan at {{L4}}; * 2 March 2033: [[617 Patroclus]], P-type [[binary asteroid|binary]] Trojan. The primary, Patroclus, has a mean diameter of 113 km; and the companion [[(617) Patroclus I Menoetius|Menoetius]] has a diameter of 112 km.<ref>{{cite press release |url=http://www.berkeley.edu/news/media/releases/2006/02/01_patroclus.shtml |title=Binary asteroid in Jupiter's orbit may be icy comet from solar system's infancy |publisher=University of California Berkeley |first=Robert |last=Sanders |date=1 February 2006 |accessdate=4 October 2017}}</ref> The pair orbit at a separation of 680 km. The binary resides in the [[Trojan camp]] at {{L5}}.

501(c)(3) non-profit organization{{cite web|title=MAGFest - What is MAGFest?|url=http://super.magfest.org/about|website=MAGFest|accessdate=12 December 2017|language=en}} | attendance = Approximately 21,000+ in 2018 | website = http://magfest.org }} '''MAGFest''' ('''M'''usic '''a'''nd '''G'''aming '''Fest'''ival, originally the Mid-Atlantic Gaming Festival) is an annual festival held in the [[Washington metropolitan area]] that celebrates [[video games]] and [[video game music]], as well as their surrounding [[Video game music culture|culture]]. MAGFest's primary features are a large open video gaming room, a hall of arcade cabinets, concerts by [[chiptune]] artists and video game cover bands, and a Bring Your Own Computer (BYOC) LAN Party. == Attractions == MAGFest's arcade hall is open 24 hours a day.{{cite web|url=http://www.destructoid.com/what-you-missed-at-magfest-8-159706.phtml|title=What you missed at MAGfest 8|first=Topher|last= Cantler}} The exhibition hall contains hundreds of full size arcade cabinets, and even pinball machines that are donated for the event from local collectors and vending companies. All arcades are set to play for free on admission price, and are monitored 24 hours a day by a maintenance and technical staff. The arcade hall is decked out with specialty lighting, laser lighting, and music to bring back the golden age of arcades. The game selection ranges from 1970's vintage black and white games, vector monitors games, Cathode Ray Tube games, modern/Indie arcades; as well as contemporary Japanese candy cabinets and Japanese dance/music games like Dance Dance Revolution and Taiko No Tatsujin. Arcades range from various manufacturers like Atari, Nintendo, Taito, Midway, Williams, Capcom, Sega, ICE, Rock Ola, and Exidy. Games challenge various abilities including driving simulators, shooting simulators, labyrinth games, and just plain fun games. There are multiple events and tournaments that occur during the event that allow you to challenge dozens of others for prizes and fame. They also host a ten-game tournament that spans the entire event which allows players to openly compete on 10 classic arcade games to work on getting the highest scores possible with the ultimate prize being given to the player who scores the most points total on all games. There is also a console hall open 24 hours a day that houses over a hundred televisions and attached game consoles, where guests are invited to play at will and each station's game is periodically swapped with a different one from a game library. Attendees are encouraged to bring their own controllers or fighting game pads to compete with. Consoles range from vintage Atari 2600, Intellivision style games all the way through the years to the most current and up to date Xbox/PS/Nintendo systems and games. Even steam titles are playable and indie game developers have been known to introduce or beta test new games at the events. Tournaments are performed frequently throughout the event on several platforms and game types for prizes. The concert areas host nightly performances in multiple rooms simultaneously of famous and up and coming bands. Music is themed, but not limited to; Chip Tunes, video game music, and related works. Many luminaries of video game music fan culture have performed at MAGFest. Previous bands include [[Machinae Supremacy]], [[Earthbound Papas]], [[Minibosses]], [[Powerglove (band)|Powerglove]], [[the NESkimos]], the Advantage and [[Chromelodeon]]. Other major attractions include guest panels from the video game industry such as [[Sid Meier]], [[Jon St. John]]{{cite news|url=https://www.wired.com/geekdad/2009/11/magfest-2010-lineup-released|title=MAGFest 2010 Lineup Released | work=Wired | date=November 21, 2009}} and [[Nobuo Uematsu]],{{cite web|url=https://www.npr.org/2012/01/18/145347111/from-mega-man-to-final-fantasy-live-video-game-music|title=From Mega Man To Final Fantasy, Live Video Game Music}} celebrated composer for many of the games in the [[Final Fantasy]] series. In addition, the fan remixing community is well represented with sites such as [[OverClocked ReMix]]. Filmmakers such as X-Strike Studios, Main Moon Productions, PBC Productions, and There Will Be Brawl have also appeared at the event. MAGFest has also included intellectually driven panels such as "Game Studies 101" where attendees were given a basic introduction to the manner in which scholars study video games. Additionally, MAGFest features DJ battles, a jam space, an open mic stage, a large [[LAN party]] environment, a film screening room, a [[tabletop games|tabletop gaming]] room, vendors, contests like "name-that-tune," and a video game "challenge booth" where players can "try to tackle insanely difficult gaming feats for prizes of all sorts."{{Cite web|url=http://terminalgamer.com/2010/01/05/recapping-magfest-8|title=Recapping MAGFest 8|first=Joe|last= Grogan}} == History == {| class="wikitable" width="100%" ! {{Infobox scientist |name = Mark Boslough |image = Mark Boslough American Geophysical Union Fall Meeting 2012.jpg |caption = American Geophysical Union Fall Meeting, December 2012, San Francisco. |birth_date = |birth_place = [[Iowa]] |death_date = |death_place = |nationality = [[United States|American]] |ethnicity = |field = [[Physics]]
[[Geophysics]] |work_institutions = [[Sandia National Laboratories]]
[[University of New Mexico]] |alma_mater = [[California Institute of Technology]]
[[Colorado State University]] |doctoral_advisor = [[Thomas J. Ahrens]] |doctoral_students = |known_for = |influences = |influenced = |prizes = |religion = | homepage = {{URL|http://www.boslough.us/}} | module = {{Listen | filename = Audio Mark Boslough.wav | title = Mark Boslough's voice | type = speech | description = recorded October 2016 at [[CSICon]] }} }} '''Mark Boslough''' is a physicist. He was a member of the technical staff at [[Sandia National Laboratories]], an adjunct professor at [[University of New Mexico]], and a [[fellow]] of the [[Committee for Skeptical Inquiry]]. He is an expert in the study of [[Impact event|planetary impacts]] and global [[Disaster|catastrophes]]. Due to his work in this field, [[Meanings of minor planet names: 73001–74000#73501–73600|Asteroid 73520 Boslough (2003 MB1)]] was named in his honor. On March 13, 2018, Boslough announced he was a [[candidate]] for the [[New Mexico House of Representatives]] and would be challenging the [[Republican Party (United States)|Republican]] [[incumbent]] William Rehm in the [[primary election]]." ==Background and education== Boslough grew up in [[Broomfield, Colorado]]. He holds a B.S. in [[physics]] at [[Colorado State University]], and an MS and PhD in [[applied physics]] at the [[California Institute of Technology]]. ==Scientific career== [[Image:MarkBosloughTunguskaSimulation2007.jpeg|thumb|left|upright=.80|Asteroid impact fireball, from supercomputer simulation run by a [[Sandia National Laboratories|Sandia]] team led by Mark Boslough]] An expert on planetary impacts and global catastrophes, Boslough's work on airbursts challenged the conventional view of [[asteroid]] collision risk and is now widely accepted by the scientific community.{{cite web|url=http://www.space.com/9256-forget-big-asteroids-smaller-rocks-sneak-blow.html |title=Forget Big Asteroids: It's the Smaller Rocks That Sneak In and Blow Up |publisher=Space.com |date=2010-10-05 |accessdate=2012-07-24}} He was the first scientist to suggest that the Libyan Desert Glass was formed by melting due to overhead heating from an airburst.{{cite journal|last = Crawford|first = D A|author2 = Boslough|title = Silica '96: Meeting on Libyan Desert Glass and related desert events|date = 18 July 1996|location = Bologna University, Italy}} His hypothesis was popularized by the documentaries "Tutunkhamun's Fireball" ([[BBC]]),https://www.imdb.com/name/nm2334005/{{cite web|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/5196362.stm |title=Science/Nature | Tut's gem hints at space impact |publisher=BBC News |date=2006-07-19 |accessdate=2012-07-24}} (recipient of [[Discover Magazine]]'s Top 100 Science Stories of 2006){{cite web|url=http://discovermagazine.com/2007/jan/cover |title=The Top 100 Science Stories of 2006 |publisher=DISCOVER Magazine |date=2007-01-08 |accessdate=2012-07-24}} and Ancient Asteroid [[National Geographic Society|National Geographic]].{{cite web|title=Ancient Asteroid Ancient Asteroid|url=http://channel.nationalgeographic.com/channel/videos/ancient-asteroid/|publisher=[[National Geographic Society|National Geographic]]|accessdate=2013-09-29}} which provided inspiration for the unorthodox and controversial notion that a large airburst over North America caused an abrupt climate change mass extinction.{{cite web|title=North American Comet Catastrophe 10,900 BC Part 2|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=I2ld-lohrPw#t=4m47s|accessdate=2013-09-29}} However, Boslough has been a leading critic of the [[Younger Dryas impact hypothesis]], arguing among other things that the proponents have misinterpreted his airburst models.{{cite book|last=Boslough|first=Mark|title=Arguments and Evidence Against a Younger Dryas Impact Event|year=2012|publisher=GEOPHYSICAL MONOGRAPH SERIES 198|pages=13–26 |author2=K. Nicoll |author3=V. Holliday |author4=T. L. Daulton |author5=D. Meltzer |author6=N. Pinter |author7=A. C. Scott |author8=T. Surovell |author9=P. Claeys |author10=J. Gill |author11=F. Paquay |author12=J. Marlon |author13=P. Bartlein |author14=C. Whitlock |author15=D. Grayson |author16=A. J. T. Jull}} He appeared as a skeptic on the "Last Extinction" [[Nova]],{{cite web|url=https://www.pbs.org/wgbh/nova/evolution/last-extinction.html |title=NOVA | Megabeasts' Sudden Death |publisher=Pbs.org |accessdate=2012-07-24}} (recipient of AAAS Kavli award for best science documentary of 2009).{{cite web|url=https://www.pbs.org/wgbh/nova/about/tvaw.html |title=NOVA | Broadcast Awards Listed by Date |publisher=PBS |accessdate=2012-07-24}} In 2011, he presented a paper at the IAA Planetary Defense Conference in [[Bucharest]], [[Romania]], in which he stated, "It is virtually certain (probability > 99%) that the next destructive NEO event will be an airburst."{{cite web|last=Boslough|first=Mark|title=Airburst Warning and Response|url=https://cfwebprod.sandia.gov/cfdocs/CCIM/docs/2166721_boslough.pdf|accessdate=2013-09-29}} This prediction proved true less than two years later, on Feb. 15, 2013, when an airburst over Chelyabinsk, Russia injured more than 1000 people. Boslough was among the first western scientists to arrive in [[Chelyabinsk]], where he did field research and accompanied a production crew filming Meteor Strike for NOVA.{{Citation|title = Watch now: NOVA {{!}} Meteor Strike {{!}} PBS Video|url = http://video.pbs.org/video/2358778286/|accessdate = 2015-07-13}} Most of the documentaries are focused on his impact and airburst modeling.{{cite web|url=https://www.pbs.org/wgbh/nova/earth/modeling-comet-airburst.html |title=NOVA | Modeling a Comet Airburst |publisher=Pbs.org |date=2009-03-01 |accessdate=2012-07-24}} In February 2011, it was announced that Boslough had been elected a [[fellow]] of the [[Committee for Skeptical Inquiry]].{{cite web|url=http://www.csicop.org/news/press_releases/show/csi_announces_new_fellows |title=CSI | Press Releases |publisher=[[Csicop.org]] |accessdate=2012-07-24}} In 2014, Boslough delivered a major address on "death plunge" asteroids that can pose a sudden danger to Earth at the second [[Starmus Festival]] in the [[Canary Islands]]. Also in 2014 he talks about his interest in asteroids to Toni Feder of Physics Today: "In his childhood home in Colorado, says Boslough, "there was a left-brain right-brain thing going on, with fiction and nonfiction in the same household."{{Cite journal|title = A passion for asteroids|url = http://scitation.aip.org/content/aip/magazine/physicstoday/news/10.1063/PT.5.9020|journal = Physics Today|date = 2014-09-02|issn = 0031-9228|doi = 10.1063/PT.5.9020|first = Toni|last = Feder}} In recognition of Boslough's work in the field of [[Impact event|planetary impacts]] and global [[Disaster|catastrophes]], Asteroid 73520 Boslough (2003 MB1) was named in his honor.{{cite web|title=JPL Small-Body Database Browser|url=http://ssd.jpl.nasa.gov/sbdb.cgi?orb=1;sstr=73520|publisher=[[NASA]]|accessdate=2012-11-23}} ===Scientific skepticism=== Boslough is a vocal critic of [[pseudoscience]] and [[anti-science]] and has written about [[climate change denial]] in the [[Skeptical Inquirer]] in reference to "[[Climategate]]" conspiracy theories.{{cite web|author=Mark Boslough |url=http://www.csicop.org/si/show/mann_bites_dog_why_climategate_was_newsworthy |title=CSI | Mann Bites Dog: Why 'Climategate' Was Newsworthy |publisher=Csicop.org |accessdate=2012-07-24}} He is also active in uncovering scientific misconduct.{{cite web|url=http://gsa.confex.com/gsa/2010AM/finalprogram/abstract_178248.htm |title=Misrepresentations Of Sargasso Sea Temperatures By Arthur B. Robinson Et Al |publisher=Gsa.confex.com |date=2010-11-03 |accessdate=2012-07-24}}{{cite web |author= |url=http://www.miller-mccune.com/science/comet-claim-comes-crashing-to-earth-31180/ |title=Comet Theory Comes Crashing to Earth |publisher=Miller-mccune.com |date=2011-05-14 |accessdate=2012-07-24 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120407090947/http://www.miller-mccune.com/science/comet-claim-comes-crashing-to-earth-31180/ |archivedate=2012-04-07 |df= }} ===Humor=== An advocate of using humor to defend science,{{cite web|url=http://www.santafenewmexican.com/Local%20News/April-Fools--Day-Sandia-labs-prankster---unleashed--cyberstorm- |title=Sandia labs prankster unleashed cyberstorm of laughs |publisher=The Santa Fe New Mexican |accessdate=2012-07-24}} he once published an essay as an [[April Fool's Day]] joke in the April, 1998 issue of the [[New Mexicans for Science and Reason]] newsletter to poke fun at [[New Mexico]]'s legislature for attempting to require schools to teach creationism. He wrote that the [[Alabama]] state legislature had voted to change the value of the mathematical constant [[pi]] from 3.14159 to the 'Biblical value' of 3.0. The article was posted on a newsgroup and passed around to people via email, causing an outrage. When people started calling the Alabama legislature to protest, the joke was revealed.{{cite web|url=http://www.nmsr.org/alabama.htm |title=Alabama π! |publisher=Nmsr.org |accessdate=2012-07-24}} [[National Geographic Society|National Geographic]] News highlighted Boslough's story when it compiled a list of "some of the more memorable hoaxes in recent history."{{cite web|url=http://news.nationalgeographic.com/news/2004/03/0331_040331_aprilfoolshoax.html |title=April Fools' Special: History's Hoaxes |publisher=News.nationalgeographic.com |date=2010-10-28 |accessdate=2012-07-24}} It was elevated by the [[Museum of Hoaxes]] to number seven on its "Top 100 April Fools Hoaxes of All Time" list.{{cite web|url=http://www.museumofhoaxes.com/hoax/aprilfool/ |title=Top 100 April Fool's Day Hoaxes Of All Time |publisher=Museumofhoaxes.com |accessdate=2012-07-24}} It eventually took on a new existence as an urban legend and has had to be debunked by [[Snopes]].{{cite web|url=http://www.snopes.com/religion/pi.asp |title=Redefinition of Pi |publisher=snopes.com |accessdate=2012-07-24}} He also demonstrated that emailed lists of "[[Darwin Awards]]" include fake stories. After receiving an annual list of unfortunate deaths at the end of 1998, he fabricated his own over-the-top fictional Darwin Award recipient, appended it, and forwarded the list to his friends. That story also went viral, was printed as an actual event by the [[Denver Post]], leading to another debunking by Snopes.{{cite web|url=http://www.snopes.com/horrors/techno/microwave.asp |title=Microwaved Workman |publisher=snopes.com |accessdate=2012-07-24}} ===Appearances in science films and TV shows === *Nova - Day the Dinosaurs Died (2017){{cite web|title=Day the Dinosaurs Died|url=http://www.pbs.org/video/day-the-dinosaurs-died-rooax3/|website=KQED|publisher=NOVA|accessdate=16 April 2018}} *Science Channel - Mysteries of the Missing (2017){{cite web|title=Mysteries of the Missing|url=https://www.sciencechannel.com/tv-shows/mysteries-of-the-missing/videos/what-really-caused-the-tunguska-event|publisher=Science Channel|accessdate=16 April 2018}} *Nelly Benhaydun Studio - Disaster Playground (2015){{cite web|title=Disaster Playground|url=http://disasterplayground.com/|accessdate=16 April 2018}} *Hubble - Mission Universum (2014){{cite web|title=Asteroiden|url=http://www.servustv.com/de/Medien/Hubble-Mission-Universum37|publisher=ServusTV|accessdate=2015-07-20}} *Smithsonian Channel - Sacred Sites:Ireland (2014){{cite web|title=Sacred Sites: Ireland|url=https://www.smithsonianchannel.com/videos/is-this-the-reason-ireland-converted-to-christianity/31864|publisher=Smithsonian Channel|accessdate=16 April 2018}} *Smithsonian Channel - Doomsday in Tunguska (2013){{cite web|title=Doomsday in Tunguska|url=https://www.smithsonianchannel.com/videos/doomsday-in-tunguska-sneak-peek/13308|publisher=Smithsonian Channel|accessdate=16 April 2018}} *Nova - Meteor Strike (2013){{cite web|title=Meteor Strike|url=http://video.pbs.org/video/2358778286/|publisher=Nova|accessdate=2013-09-30}} *Meteor Strike Fireball from Space (2013){{cite web|title=Meteor strike fireball from space|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=T9Iae8C_dks|accessdate=2013-09-29}} *Fire in the Sky (2013){{cite web|title=Fire in the Sky|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=qQ0VqEZ8Vho|publisher=Discovery Canada|accessdate=2013-09-29}} * Nova - Asteroids, Doomsday or Payday (2013){{cite web|title=Asteroids, Doomsday or Payday|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=DrsjHpVF128|publisher=Nova|accessdate=16 April 2018}} *The Truth About Meteors: A Horizon Special Part 1 (2013){{cite web|title=The Truth About Meteors: A Horizon Special Part 1|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=vQp7cVu3Ny0|accessdate=2013-09-29}} *Connect 105: Viewer Question (Asteroid Explosion) (2012){{cite web|title=Viewers Questions|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=PdBtt5hJ0dw&list=PLECD54524AFD932E4&index=13|publisher=Connect 105|accessdate=2013-09-29}} *The Universe (TV Series): When Space Changed History" (2012), [[History (U.S. TV channel)|The History Channel]], himself. *Espace Franco - Avoiding Apocalypse (2012){{cite web|title=Avoiding Apocalypse|url=http://www.filmoption.com/international_sector/showdetails.asp?id=576|website=Filmoption|publisher=Espace Franco|accessdate=16 April 2018}} *Asteroids: The Good, the Bad, and the Ugly (2010), [[BBC Horizon]], as Dr. Mark Boslough. *Expedition Apocalypse (2010), [[National Geographic (magazine)|National Geographic]], himself. *Megabeasts' Sudden Death (2009), [[Nova (TV series)]], himself. *Close Encounters in Siberia (2009){{cite web|title=Close Encounters In Siberia|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=WXaBnjEOqcA&playnext=1&list=PL292F7B755E32F897&feature=results_main|publisher=Channel 4|accessdate=2013-09-29}} *[[Animal Armageddon]] (2009), [[Animal Planet]], himself. *Countdown to Impact (2009), [[National Geographic Channel]], as Dr. Mark Boslough. *[[The Universe (TV series)|The Universe (TV Series):]] Deadly Comets and Meteors" (2008), [[History (U.S. TV channel)|The History Channel]], himself. *Asteroid Trackers (2008), [[Discovery Channel (Canada)]], himself. *Siberian Apocalypse (2008), [[Discovery Channel]], himself. *Big Bang in Tunguska (2008), German TV documentary, as Dr. Mark Boslough. *Dino Meteor (2007), [[National Geographic Channel]], himself. *Ancient Asteroid (2006), [[National Geographic Channel]], himself. *Tutankhamun's Fireball (2006), [[BBC Horizon]], as Dr. Mark Boslough. *The Day the Earth Got Hit (1997), British TV documentary, himself. == Political career == In a tweet on March 13, 2018, Boslough announced he was a [[candidate]] for the [[New Mexico House of Representatives]], saying "I will be on the [[Primary election|primary ballot]] on June 5, 2018. I am challenging the [[incumbent]] [[National Rifle Association|NRA]]-supported candidate, William Rehm, in NM district 31."{{cite web|title=I have officially declared my candidacy...|url=https://twitter.com/MarkBoslough/status/973739446691495936|website=Twitter|publisher=Twitter|accessdate=16 March 2018|archiveurl=https://archive.is/lMrXL|archivedate=16 March 2018|date=13 March 2018|dead-url=no}} According to the ''New Mexico Political Report'': {{Quote|text=Republican Bill Rehm is in one of the most [[Republican Party (United States)|Republican]] districts in the state. So his biggest challenge could be Mark Boslough, a scientist from Sandia Labs, in the primary... The winner of the primary will face a Libertarian opponent, William Arnold Wiley Jr.{{cite web|last1=Reichbach|first1=Matthew|title=2018 House: The primaries|url=http://nmpoliticalreport.com/813719/house-gop-leader-retirement-shock-on-legislative-filing-day/|website=NMpoliticalreport.com|publisher=NM Political Report|accessdate=16 March 2018|archiveurl=https://archive.is/NSMki|archivedate=16 March 2018|date=13 March 2018|dead-url=no}}}} ===Private property rights=== Boslough is an advocate of laws to reform the 19th-century law known as [[Revised statute 2477|RS 2477]] to prevent it from being used to take private property for public use.{{Cite web|title = ESR {{!}} February 23, 2004 {{!}} RS 2477 reform is needed to protect private property|url = http://www.enterstageright.com/archive/articles/0204/0204rs2477.htm|website = www.enterstageright.com|accessdate = 2015-07-13}} His fight turned into a prolonged battle with off-road clubs pulling out boulders and seedlings that Boslough used to try and restore his property.{{cite web|last = Cart|first = Julie|title = Rights (Page 2 of 2) Dust-Up Over Off-Roaders Roars Across Backcountry|url = http://articles.latimes.com/2003/sep/21/local/me-offroad21/2|publisher = [[LA Times]]|accessdate = 12 February 2012}} He also received verbal and physical threats before he successfully defended a lawsuit (Ramey v. Boslough) in which the ownership of a four-wheel-drive road across his Colorado property was challenged by a plaintiff who was backed by off-road recreation interests.{{cite web|title = The Good, the Bad, and the Ugly|url = http://saveourcanyons.org/files/images/Autumn%2007%20NL.pdf|publisher = Citizens' Committee to Save Our Canyons|accessdate = 12 February 2012}} He used this experience to argue that the "right to radiate" is a prescriptive private property right, and that carbon polluters must compensate individuals for degrading their personal cooling capacity.{{cite web|last = Boslough|first = Mark|title = The Right to Radiate|url = http://www.huffingtonpost.com/mark-boslough/the-right-to-radiate_b_1709866.html|publisher = Huff Post|accessdate = 12 February 2012}} ==See also== *[[Indiana Pi Bill]] ==References== {{Reflist|30em}} ==External links== *[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=sx-v_nBLiLo&feature=youtu.be TEDxABQ 2012] *[http://boslough.us/ Mark Boslough link to political campaign] {{Authority control}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Boslough, Mark}} [[Category:American physicists]] [[Category:Hoaxes in the United States]] [[Category:April Fools' Day]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:1998 hoaxes]] [[Category:American skeptics]] [[Category:Fellows of the Committee for Skeptical Inquiry]] [[Category:University of New Mexico faculty]] [[Category:People from Broomfield, Colorado]] [[Category:Sandia National Laboratories people]]

The '''McDonald's Gospelfest''' is an annual [[gospel music]] festival, talent competition, and fundraiser in [[Newark, New Jersey]]. The event, inaugurated in 1983, and sponsored by [[McDonald's]], takes place in spring and has been held at the [[Prudential Center]] since 2008. The closing night contest and ceremony is produced, directed, and hosted by A. Curtis Farrow. The event, which can take several hours, has been recorded and broadcast variously on [[WABC-TV]] and [[WWOR-TV]]. Involving more a thousand performers it has been described as the "largest collection of gospel talent ever assembled"<ref>{{cite web | title = Gospel Comes To Newark At 2011 McDonald’s Gospelfest | publisher = CBS Local | date = June 18, 2011 | url = http://newyork.cbslocal.com/2011/06/18/gospel-comes-to-newark-at-2011-mcdonalds-gospelfest/ | accessdate = 2012-10-15}}</ref> and the "most spectacular gospel celebration in the nation".<ref name=gospcity>{{cite web| last = | first = | title = Gospelfest 2009| work = | publisher = Gospel City.com| date = | url = http://www.gospelcity.com/news/events/465| accessdate = 2012-10-15| archive-url = https://web.archive.org/web/20120120131028/http://www.gospelcity.com/news/events/465#| archive-date = 2012-01-20| dead-url = yes| df = }}</ref> The event is followed up by McDonald's Inspiration Celebration which makes a national tour.<ref>{{cite web | last = floyd | first = Kimberly | title = McDonald’s Presents Inspiration Celebration Gospel Tour Featuring Fred Hammond | publisher = Digital Urban Voice | date = May 14, 2012 | url = http://rollingout.com/music/mcdonalds-presents-inspiration-celebration-gospel-tour-featuring-fred-hammond/ | accessdate = 2012-10-15}}</ref><ref>{{cite web | title = GRAMMY-Winning Gospel Artist Fred Hammond, McDonald’s Raise Funds for Ronald McDonald House Charities through Inspiration Celebration Gospel Tour | publisher = | date = | url = http://www.multivu.com/mnr/57816-mcdonalds-rmhc-inspiration-celebration-gospel-tour-fred-hammond | accessdate = 2012-10-15 | archive-url = https://web.archive.org/web/20120909164909/http://www.multivu.com/mnr/57816-mcdonalds-rmhc-inspiration-celebration-gospel-tour-fred-hammond# | archive-date = 2012-09-09 | dead-url = yes | df = }}</ref><ref>{{cite web | last = Mcghee | first = Cecil | title = The McDonald’s Inspiration Celebration Gospel Tour Kicks Off Today With Fred Hammond, Byron Cage And More! | publisher = PraisePhilly | date = May 12, 2012 | url = http://praisephilly.com/2085407/the-mcdonalds-inspiration-celebration-gospel-tour-kicks-off-today-with-fred-hammond-byron-cage-and-more/ | accessdate = 2012-10-15}}</ref>
==History== [[File:Prudential Center outside corner.jpg|thumb|Gospelfest has taken place at Prudential Center 2008-2017]] McDonald's Gospelfest originated in 1983 under the auspices of the [[McDonald's Corporation]] and the McDonald's Tri-State Owners' Association. The event has been an important fundraising event which supports education opportunities within local communities. and has awarded millions of dollars in scholarship money. Over the years the competition performances have taken place at [[Stamford Center for the Arts|Palace Theater]],<ref>{{cite web | title = McDonald's Gospelfest 2003 | work = | publisher = TheaterMania | date = | url = http://www.theatermania.com/connecticut-theater/shows/mcdonalds-gospelfest-2003-20-years-of-praise_21088/ | accessdate = 2012-10-15}}</ref> the [[Hammerstein Ballroom]],<ref>{{citation | last = Gladstone | first = Valerie | title = Dance Stepping and Stomping in an old time gospel mood | newspaper = The New York Times | date = June 2, 2002 | url = https://www.nytimes.com/2002/06/02/arts/dance-stepping-and-stomping-in-an-old-time-gospel-mood.html?pagewanted=all | accessdate = 2012-10-15}}</ref> [[Westbury Music Fair]], [[Newark Symphony Hall]], [[Madison Square Garden]],<ref>{{citation | last = Respect, but This Time Delivering It to a Higher Power | first = Jon | title = Respect, but This Time Delivering It to a Higher Power | newspaper = The New York Times | date = June 6, 2005 | url = | accessdate = 2012-10-15}}</ref> and [[New York City Center]].<ref>{{citation | last = Coyne | first = Kevin | title = Singing, with their eyes on the prize | newspaper = The New York Times | date = June 23, 2006 | url = https://www.nytimes.com/2006/06/23/nyregion/nyregionspecial2/25njcol.html?fta=y | accessdate = 2012-10-15}}</ref> Since 2008, the 25th incarnation of the event, it has been held at [[Prudential Center]]. ==Competition== Auditions and semi-finalist competitions are held in [[New York metropolitan area|tri-state New York-New Jersey-Connecticut]] each year prior to the Gospelfest. There are fourteen categories: *1. Praise Dance Group *2. Praise Dance Solo-Trio *3. Gospel Rap *4. Gospel Comedian *5. Gospel Poetry *6. Step *7. Adult Choir *8. Group Soul *9. Contemporary *10. Spanish Language Soloist *11. Teen Soloist *12. Gospel Soloist *13. Youth Choir *14. Out-of-Town Choir

{{About|grassroots methods of coin debasement|coin debasement generally|debasement}} '''Coin debasement''' is the act of decreasing the amount of precious metal in a coin, while continuing to circulate it at face value. This was frequently done by governments in order to [[inflation|inflate]] the amount of currency in circulation; typically, some of the precious metal was replaced by a cheaper metal when the coin was minted. But when done by an individual, precious metal was physically removed from the coin, which could then be passed on at the original face value, leaving the debaser with a profit. Coin debasement was effected by several methods, including '''clipping''' (shaving metal from the coin's circumference) and '''sweating''' (shaking the coins in a bag and collecting the dust worn off). Until the mid-20th century, coins were often made of [[silver]] or [[gold]], which were quite soft and prone to wear. This meant coins naturally got lighter (and thus less valuable) as they aged, so coins that had lost a small amount of [[bullion]] would go unnoticed. Modern coins are made of hard, cheap metals such as [[steel]], [[copper]], or a [[copper-nickel]] alloy, reducing wear and making it difficult and unprofitable to debase them. Clipping is the act of shaving off a small portion of a precious metal coin for profit. Over time, the precious metal clippings could be saved up and melted into bullion or used to make new coins. {{cite book |publisher = Harriman House |year = 2008 |title = The origin of financial crises |first = George |last = Cooper |page = 46 |url = https://books.google.com/books?id=4XWH_SqAkHMC&pg=PA46#v=onepage&q&f=false |deadurl = no |archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20130115201955/http://books.google.com/books?id=4XWH_SqAkHMC&pg=PA46#v=onepage&q&f=false |archivedate = 2013-01-15 |df = }} {{cite book |year = 2000 |publisher = Cambridge University Press |isbn = 0-521-57091-3 |title = Bimetallism: an economic and historical analysis |first = Angela |last = Redish |url = https://books.google.com/books?id=w6cePxd3--UC&pg=PA54#v=onepage&q&f=false |page = 54 |deadurl = no |archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20171228230829/https://books.google.com/books?id=w6cePxd3--UC&pg=PA54#v=onepage&q&f=false |archivedate = 2017-12-28 |df = }} Coin clipping was usually considered by the law to be of a similar magnitude to [[counterfeit]]ing, and was occasionally punished by [[capital punishment|death]],See for example the English [[Treason Act 1415]].{{sfn|Allen|2009|p=71}} a fate which befell English counterfeiters [[Thomas Rogers and Anne Rogers]] in 1690. Coin clipping is why many coins have the rim of the coin [[reeding|marked with stripes]] (''milling'' or ''reeding''), text (''[[engraving]]'') or some other pattern that would be destroyed if the coin were clipped. This practice is attributed to [[Isaac Newton]], who was appointed [[Master of the Mint]] in 1699.{{cite book|author=Great Britain. Treasury. Information Division|title=Economic Progress Report|url=https://books.google.es/books?id=eq20AAAAIAAJ&q=the+origin+of+the+process+is+attributed+to+%5B%5BIsaac+Newton%5D%5D,+after+being+appointed+%5B%5BMaster+of+the+Mint%5D%5D+%28charge+he+held&dq=the+origin+of+the+process+is+attributed+to+%5B%5BIsaac+Newton%5D%5D,+after+being+appointed+%5B%5BMaster+of+the+Mint%5D%5D+%28charge+he+held&hl=ca&sa=X&ei=mGS-VKGZKYOqU7HiguAH&ved=0CCEQ6AEwAA|year=1986|publisher=Information Division of the Treasury.|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170823210524/https://books.google.es/books?id=eq20AAAAIAAJ&q=the+origin+of+the+process+is+attributed+to+%5B%5BIsaac+Newton%5D%5D,+after+being+appointed+%5B%5BMaster+of+the+Mint%5D%5D+%28charge+he+held&dq=the+origin+of+the+process+is+attributed+to+%5B%5BIsaac+Newton%5D%5D,+after+being+appointed+%5B%5BMaster+of+the+Mint%5D%5D+%28charge+he+held&hl=ca&sa=X&ei=mGS-VKGZKYOqU7HiguAH&ved=0CCEQ6AEwAA|archivedate=2017-08-23|df=}} Although the metal used in most modern fiat coins has insignificant intrinsic value, modern milling can be a deterrent to counterfeiting, an aid to the blind to distinguish different denominations, or purely decorative.
{{Gallery | title = Comparison of unclipped and clipped ''[[Siliqua]]'' from the [[Hoxne Hoard]] | lines = 1 | width = 200 | height = 160 |File:Hoxne Hoard coins 6a.jpg|alt1=A silver coin in the centre a helmeted head surrounded by a circle of inscription with edging between that and the rim. |An unclipped ''siliqua'' |File:Hoxne Hoard coins 6b.jpg|alt2=A smaller silver coin in the centre a head - still a fairly round coin but the inscription is not intact and there is no space between it and the rim |Partially clipped ''siliqua'' |File:Hoxne Hoard coins 6c.jpg|alt3=A small silver coin mostly consisting of a human head and shoulders. The shape is irregular and there is only a vestige of writing. |A clipped ''siliqua'' }}
In the process of sweating, coins were placed in a bag and shaken. The bits of metal that had worn off the coins were recovered from the bottom of the bag.{{sfn|Sherwood|1893|p=70}} Sweating tended to wear the coin in a more natural way than clipping, and so was harder to detect.{{sfn|Allen|2009|p=72}} If the coin was large, a hole could be punched out of the middle, and the face of the coin hammered to close up the hole.{{sfn|Sherwood|1893|p=70–71}} Or the coin could be sawed in half, and a plug of metal extracted from the interior. After filling the hole with a cheaper metal, the two halves would be welded back together again.{{sfn|Sherwood|1893|p=71}} Verbal references to plugged quarters and plugged dimes eventually yielded the common phrase ''"not worth a plugged nickel"'' (or 'plug nickel', or even a plugged cent), emphasizing the worthlessness of such a tampered coin.{{cite web|url=http://www.phrases.org.uk/meanings/260800.html|title=The meaning and origin of the expression: Not worth a plugged nickel|publisher=Phrase Dictionary|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160410020340/http://www.phrases.org.uk/meanings/260800.html|archivedate=2016-04-10|df=}} ==References== {{Reflist}} *{{cite book |title= The encyclopedia of money |last1= Allen |first1= Larry |year= 2009 |publisher= [[ABC-CLIO]] |url= https://books.google.com/books?id=X4kgDkYxGrcC |edition= 2 |isbn= 978-1-59884-251-7 |ref= harv}} *{{cite book |title= The history and theory of money |last1= Sherwood |first1= Sidney |year= 1893 |publisher= [[J. B. Lippincott & Co.|Lippincott]] |url= https://books.google.com/books?id=Q0USAQAAMAAJ |ref= harv}} ==External links== *[https://www.usmint.gov/kids/coinNews/funFacts.html US Mint Fun Facts] [[Category:Coins]] [[Category:Commercial crimes]]

The {{nihongo|'''''Morrison'' incident'''|モリソン号事件|Morison-gō Jiken}} of 1837 occurred when the [[United States|American]] merchant ship, ''Morrison'' headed by [[Charles W. King]], was driven away from "[[sakoku]]" (isolationist) [[Japan]] by cannon fire. This was carried out in accordance with the Japanese [[Edict to Repel Foreign Vessels]] of 1825.
==History== In addition to its commercial aims, the ship was attempting to repatriate seven shipwrecked Japanese citizens who had been picked up in [[Macau]]. It also carried Christian missionaries such as [[Samuel Wells Williams]].
The nature of the ship's mission became known one year after the event, and this resulted in increased criticism of the Edict.
== Notes == Among the Japanese [[castaway]]s was [[Otokichi|Yamamoto Otokichi]], who became known for his role in bridging the cultural gap between Japan and rest of the world.

{{multiple issues|{{news release|date=December 2015}} {{more citations needed|date=December 2015}}}}
The '''National Service-Learning Conference''' was first held in 1988 to serve as "the largest gathering of youth and practitioners from the service-learning movement" of the United States. The conference is a program of the [[National Youth Leadership Council]], and is co-hosted annually by partner organizations in the state or region where it is being held. Sponsors of the conference include [[United Parcel Service]], [[Best Buy]], [http://www.sef.org Shinnyo-en Foundation], [[United Way of America]], and E. Ronald and Patricia Parish.
The conference focuses on service-learning, an approach to teaching and learning in which students use academic knowledge and skills to address genuine community needs. Annually, the National Service-Learning Conference convenes teachers and other service-learning practitioners, administrators, researchers, policy-makers, youth leaders, parents, program coordinators, national service members, community-based organization staffs, and corporate and foundation officers. The conference is unique because typically youth comprise more than half its attendees and are treated as equal contributors. Youth present, exhibit, and attend the three-and-a-half-day event same as their adult counterparts.
Each year the conference features over 200 workshop sessions, thought-leader sessions, keynote addresses, an interactive exhibit hall with a service-learning showcase and college fair, both on- and off-site service-learning projects to allow participants an authentic learning opportunity, an administrator's academy, indigenous service-learning forum, preconference sessions for in-depth learning, as well as countless networking and professional development opportunities. Speakers from around the world present on international issues and help to ground the conference in a rapidly globalizing world. Artists, students, and community members from the host locale contribute to the ambiance of the conference each year. The hallways, exhibit hall aisles, and general spaces are transformed with spoken word, drumming, murals, paintings, etc. The conference takes on the culture of the city that hosts it, from the local food that is served to service projects that provide a deeper understanding of the host city.
For 2012, the conference was co-hosted with [http://www.youthrive.net/ youthrive], the upper midwest affiliate of [[PeaceJam]], and presented as The 23rd Annual National Service-Learning Conference & youthrive PeaceJam Leadership Conference. In addition to the full range of conference workshops and activities, the partnership with youthrive PeaceJam brought Nobel Laureate [[Shirin Ebadi]] as a featured speaker, and the week-long event ended with a celebration of [[Global Youth Service Day]] at the [[Mall of America]].
The Service-Learning World Forum began in 2008 as a pre-conference session of the larger conference and is now an integral program of the larger conference. The World Forum engages attendees with international leaders, exploring youth service and service-learning as forces that span cultural and national boundaries, building communities and strengthening young people. World Forum attendees discover how service-learning is implemented from Ireland, to Argentina, to the Middle East, and is useful for both those working internationally and those interested in expanding their programs.
Each year since 2003 the conference has highlighted the National Service-Learning Awards. Awards are presented to leaders in the field of service-learning, both youths and adults. In 2006 the first William James National Service Lifetime Achievement Award was presented by the National Youth Leadership Council in conjunction with several leading service organizations. The award was given to former Senator Harris Wofford and presented by President Bill Clinton, Kathleen Kennedy Townsend, and Dr. James Kielsmeier. Since its inception, the conference has planted trees in each city that has hosted the event, in honor of the service-learning award winners.
The October 2009 issue of ''One+'' magazine featured a four-page article highlighting the conference and its commitment to the community. One+ magazine is the official publication of Meeting Planners International. One+ is the leading voice of the meeting and event industry, reaching 30,000+ industry professionals on six continents.
